abstract: Penn West Energy Trust, a Canadian energy trust, agreed to acquire Canetic Resources Trust for about 3.6 billion Canadian dollars ($3.8 billion) to cushion the impact of a new tax. The combined trust would have tax pools, or accrued credits used to reduce tax payments, valued at about 5.5 billion Canadian dollars at the end of 2007, according to the statement. Canetic’s unit holders would receive 0.515 of a Penn West unit and a distribution of 9 cents a Canetic unit before the closing, according to the companies. That values the offer at 15.84 Canadian dollars for each Canetic unit, 7.1 percent above the closing price on Tuesday. Both companies are based in Calgary.

lead_paragraph: Penn West Energy Trust, a Canadian energy trust, agreed to acquire Canetic Resources Trust for about 3.6 billion Canadian dollars ($3.8 billion) to cushion the impact of a new tax. The combined trust would have tax pools, or accrued credits used to reduce tax payments, valued at about 5.5 billion Canadian dollars at the end of 2007, according to the statement. Canetic’s unit holders would receive 0.515 of a Penn West unit and a distribution of 9 cents a Canetic unit before the closing, according to the companies. That values the offer at 15.84 Canadian dollars for each Canetic unit, 7.1 percent above the closing price on Tuesday. Both companies are based in Calgary.

abstract: Most phones sold in the United States are locked into the carrier that sold them. But that has not stopped many from unlocking phones, either with the permission of the carrier or without it.
snippet: Most phones sold in the United States are locked into the carrier that sold them. But that has not stopped many from unlocking phones, either with the permission of the carrier or without it.
lead_paragraph: NOKIA, the world’s largest maker of cellphones, has been running ads that read, “Open to Anything” and “Unlock your potential.”

headline.main: Locked vs. Unlocked: Opening Up Choice
headline.print_headline: Locked vs. Unlocked: Opening Up Choice
